newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech PSE edges up, takeover battles buoy issues.
newsitem.headline: Czech PSE edges up, takeover battles buoy issues.

text.p: The Prague Stock Exchange edged higher in heavier trading on Tuesday, buoyed by several broader issues involved in takeover battles.
Major issues were mixed with Komercni Banka backing off of Monday's year high while SPT Telecom posted modest gains as the PX50 index inched up 1.6 points to 571.6.
Overall, advancers outpaced decliners by 195 to 135 with 78 issues trading unchanged. Total volume was heavy with 1.16 million shares changing hands on light turnover of 534.5 million crowns.

But it was the performance of a few broader issues that continued to catch most analyst's attention, as rumours of takeover battles for beverage maker Seliko and glass fibre maker Vertex push prices through the roof.

Seliko, the object of a battle of between unnamed investment groups, jumped 158 crowns to 3,333, and hit as high as 20,000 crowns on the OTC market, according to bourse figures, though on minor volumes.
Vertex, also rumoured to be involved in a battle for control, climbed a solid 238 crowns to 5,009.

"The thing is that all of these prices have nothing to do with the fundamentals, only takeover battles. Right now, I doubt many portfolio investors would buy Vertex or Seliko," said Jan Sykora of the brokerage Wood and Company.
"You would be buying into a stock where you have no control of its price and it does not reflect the fundamentals of the company at all," he added.
